result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markis Devon Crenshaw

records.addlTxt: TRIAL SCHEDULING ORDER
Jury trial on March 13, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Jury selection on March 13, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on February 14, 2023 at 08:30 am.
9:23 AM Defendant Markis Devon Crenshaw appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling order to be sent out to parties.
Letter Motion for a Continuance
Calendar call on September 6, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

08:34 AM Defendant Markis Devon Crenshaw in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Reed Cornia by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes judicial notice of 18CF291 and 20CF673. Officer Michael Doran sworn in and testified by video. Witness identifed Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

Activity:Return on warrant initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:44 PM Defendant Markis Devon Crenshaw in court by video in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Mason C Braunschweig and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant vacated. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $10,000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim M.C., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. May not possess any weapons.
